text: I just moved to the neighborhood about a month ago and wish I had tried this place sooner. Good beer, good food, friendly and knowledgeable staff. I'll definitely be back.
They card like it's nobody's business. Good luck if you are over 40 and forget your ID. Good luck if you want to bring your baby for dinner. I am no longer going here

Hopleaf is unexepectadly cooler and bigger inside than what you might expect from a street view...and it is for this reason that one of my co-workers (who knows how completely obsessed I am with Yelp and trying awesome local joints) suggested that we celebrate my last day at our company/the start of graduate school by coming here.  So, we made a hop, skip and a jump over to Hopleaf...I assume it's gotten it's name from from the hoppy leaves that make up the composition of their many beers... For a beer lover, this definitely is a bar that should be a stop along the drinking route.  There are several beers on tap here - I might be slightly off in this assessment, but I'd say that half the selection is a mixture of pale ale's and IPA's  (with a fee other random, married beers thrown in the mix) and the other half being Belgium beers.  There's a fair mixture, but I know some of my co-workers left being slightly dissatisfied with the selection.  I enjoyed all my beers, especially because they seemed slightly more affordable than those found at bars in the same Andersonville area.  (For those that are not beer drinkers, there is a full bar and wine options). Out of the many things on the menu, only one thing stood out to me and that was the CB&J sandwich (which has fig and some sweet aioli with cheese)...it was scrumptious.  My mouth is watering now just thinking about it.  The fries that came with it were pretty good, but the Mac n' cheese was gross...as my co-worker put it: "it tastes like the iron skillet it was made in". I spent a lengthy amount of time here, partying it up with my co-workers and friends...it is easy to hang here for a while, especially if you get there before the rush and find good seating.  Now, to have the best experience you don't want to sit in what my friend says is the "bougie" side (the side where you walk into), but rather walk to the other open area that connects to the beer garden!  Granted, that's the side that gets busier and it's the side where the bartender lost my friend's credit card, but I still liked that side better.  But yes, the bartender lost her card and couldn't find it anywhere...thankfully her drinks and meal were comped, but my question is, "how the neck did they lose the card?".  Though this bartender was friendly, some of the other staff were not so friendly and that's always a no-no for me.  If I could, I would give this place a 3.5 - it's good, not great but you could probably find me wandering back inside at some point.

We did not eat dinner, but LOVE the beer selection. I've been coming for 22 years, and will continue to. However, be forewarned: they don't let you in without an ID, even for dinner (at least on a Saturday night). Not even if you are obviously over 50 and have all-gray hair. It's very weird, actually. But if you know ahead of time, it's not an issue. They will not let kids in at all, they say.

A very cool pub that me and my friend visited yesterday. It's a huge place with a lot of draft beers and no TVs which is cool. We came mainly just to grab a bite and have a beer. I got the ham sandwich while my friend got the beef brisket. He seems to enjoy his while I thought the ham sandwich was OK, I probably wouldn't order it again. It came with a lot of fries and an aioli dip that was good. Half the fries were soggy which I hate, but they load you on the fries. Service was pretty quick and we got our food in a reasonable time. I don't live around the area but I'd probably come for the booze and not the food if I were to come back.
Saw all the yelp reviews. Don't get all the hype, I can here to eat. Food was very okay, nothing special for me.
Both the indoor and outdoor seating is excellent. Be sure to try the charcuterie and the nueske's ham sandwich! Highly recommend!

Weird first experience.  Got seated and everything was fine. Our drinks took a while to get to us, but we're very good and very affordable, though at this point our server was VERY quiet and awkward. We got our appetizer and it was great. The server didn't ask if it was though. Our entrees came and were great as well, but my girlfriend ordered steak, and our server didn't ask if it was cooked correctly (whichmy food service people know is the first thing you ask). The portions were massive as well, which was a very pleasant surprise.  The server didn't really check on us even when our drinks were dwindling. We asked to speak to a manager, and lo and behold, it was our server. We voiced our complaints, to which she was receptive and apologetic.  All in all, five stars. I get it, the patio was packed. You probably had a long day. Your other tables were probably dicks. You may not wait tables normally. I've been there. Shits tough. The rest of the shop was running super smooth though, so props to you. Stoked to try this place again and enjoy the food regardless of the service, which I'm sure will be great.

Entering Hopleaf was like entering a little bar Narnia. There were endless unique rooms, multiple bars, indoor and outdoor seating, and the place seemed to go on and on. Service was wonderful and the drinks were good.  The menu is impressive and I had a really innovative duck rueben sandwich. It was very good, but the fries which came with were out of this world. Being a Chicago bar, it was a bit pricy, but you probably shouldn't be going out in Chicago unless you're ready to shell out a few tens.  All in all, a great night out.

Went to check it out with a few friends to catch up. I think it's a great casual restaurant and bar. We got some drinks which were on the $$ range. The servers were friendly and quick with our appetizers. I thought it was okay but I do want to go back for the dinner menu and maybe get a seat at their outside seating area. The dinner menu and specials sounded really good

Literally the best bar in Chicago. Knowledgeable staff, great selection, awesome food. Busy but you can find a seat in one of the rooms. I think of myself as a regular but I still get carded every time I walk in!?! Anyway cannot recommend enough. Mussels, fries, and the Beer

First time here. Very nice place. Great beer selection. The ambience is great for a date night. Not really a place to come party with friends. The outdoor patio is great for a summer night. Customer service was great. Would definitely come back for a date.

Belgian mussels are to die for. Also, huge patio out back and about a million different levels. Have lived close to this place for about a year, my only regret is not going sooner.  Beer is AWESOME as well.

My go-to hang in Andersonville. I'm not a huge fan of the food because it tends to be on the heavy side and I've had some hit or miss orders (brisket sandwhich was kinda gross to be honest), but I like the selection of beer!! So amazing!

Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon, pretty easy street parking around the corner on Foster.  No wait for a table on the patio.  Staff was very friendly but low key, aka perfect in my opinion.  Hopleaf has expertly nailed the vibe of a Brussels or Antwerp beer bar; from the ambiance to the decor to the Tolstoy like beer menu and the pared down culinary selections.  It was very reminiscent of Billie's Bier Kafeteria in Antwerp.  We started with a nice, tart goat cheese.  I went with the Belgian style moules frites as a main, and my girlfriend opted for the cashew butter and fig jam sandwich with a side of stilton mac n cheese.  Both were excellent.  We capped off lunch with chocolat pot de creme, which was also amazing.  Throw in a bottle of the best beer in the world, duchesse de bourgogne, triple karmeliet on draft and a glass of mead (like you do after shooting bow) and all in all the best meal under $100 we've had in two years in Chicago.

The beer selection is one of the best I've seen. The patio and indoor seating are both great, and I've never had a bad experience with staff. The menu is interesting which can be a good or a bad thing depending on your taste.

Great atmosphere in the bar, dining area or outside patio. Extensive beer menu where you can find anything you're looking for. Brisket sandwich wasn't my favorite but I'd definitely go back and try something else.
I love a good beer garden, and Hopleaf's is lovely. I had some really interesting Belgian beer, yummy pommes frites and delicious chevre cheese with jam and walnuts. Will be back!
Solid food- even though I think more should be offered on the menu. Beer selection and specials are plentiful.  Patio is clutch and perfect for a summer date night fellas ;) you will thank me later
I can't believe I haven't reviewed hopleaf yet! It is definitely my go to for going out in Andersonville. Amazing beer selection, great food. GET THE FRIES.

I like this place a lot. Nice atmosphere, great beer and really good beer deals throughout the week. I love that their menu changes regularly and that they have a nice variety of foods to choose from. The sandwiches are solid. My only complaint is that the duck reuben and CB and J are too greasy (literally dripping with oil). The environment is friendly and is a great place for 2 or for 10 people.

I've been to Hopleaf 4 or 5 times now and it's one of my favorite spots in Andersonville. Huge selection of delicious beers! The CB&J is the best sandwich; basically a grown up PB&J. The macaroni with a blend of gruyere and bleu cheeses is worth ordering (it comes as a side of you do the CB&J). I could eat a mountain of their fries, especially with the garlic aioli dipping sauce. Hopleaf is great for any kind of night since you can sit down and be waited on or they have tons of bar space and more casual tables.

My favorite place to go in Andersonville! This place has an amazing selection of draft beers, inventive menu and a friendly staff. Not only do the employees know how to treat their customers, but they are also knowledgable of the giant beer selection.

Intriguing, perhaps somewhat overrated, but still entertaining gastropub in the part of Chicago that's still pretty close to the Northern Suburbs. A lot of the food is really delicious! The space is casual and comfortable. Sometimes the staff can be quite short with customers, but all in a days work I suppose. They have a ton of beers to try and some good samplings of food to accompany. It used to be a great spot to hangout before the neo-futurists show but I believe the actors have closed up shop. All in all, a solid place to grab a beer and snacks.

The guy checking ID at the door was super kind and informative, and the host who seated us was efficient and got us a great spot by the windowed open-concept kitchen. Our server was quick and attentive without being omnipresent and we got in and out of the place in like, 45 minutes. The service is quick and the staff genuinely cares about the customer experience. The beer selection is robust and has something for everyone (including sour beers! Very neat.) I had the catfish hoagie, my girlfriend had an arugula salad, everything was mind-blowing tasty and the portions were the perfect size.  Cool ambience, great food, good service, would definitely recommend.
Food was excellent! The service was fantastic as well. I highly recommend trying out all the appetizers. Enjoy it!

I've always come into Hopleaf for the bar section.  I almost didn't even know there was a restaurant or care enough to ask about/look into food.   There is. The food is outstanding, paired with beers that are very hard to find, anywhere.  A great neighborhood treasure.  Will be back again.

The best Belgian beer list I've seen. Dozens on draft and an absurd number in bottles. That makes this probably my #1 beer pub. The food was quite good too, especially the frites. Nice outdoor seating and plenty of room inside too.

This place is so freaking rad. I used to go here more often and had always really liked it, but it has been about 5 years since my last visit. AGH. I suck for waiting so long to come back. This place is so good! The beers quality and selection is more than impressive, food is delicious, great atmosphere.. I really don't know what else I could ask for... snappier service? Even that's not bad. Yay to this Belgian spot!

Having been to this place twice now, I think it deserves huge props for all the beers and spirits they house. Having gone just for a couple minutes on a bar crawl previously, they had awesome specials (5$ delirium tremens on draft) and other great beer selections. Having gone there on a slower day, we had a chance to enjoy looking through the menu and even had a chance to explore he back bar they have on the other side of the restaraunt. They had over 20 taps as well as a wide selection of bottled beer. Though we didn't eat, the menu looked amazing and smelled great from surrounding guests.  HIGHLY recommend for all people, not just the beer snobs ;)

The beer list is amazing and the wait staff is courteous and knowledgeable. We've had the sausage platter, fries and indulged in one of the most fantastic pork chops that we'd ever eaten. We also ordered the ribeye, which was fantastic. On top of the inviting outdoor patio, delicious food and outstanding selection of drinks...there are NO KIDS ALLOWED. It's delightful!
Interesting menu. Pork belly NLT a favorite. Chicken wings, not a favorite. I love cilantro but these were a bit of overkill on cilantro.

I've heard nothing but great things about Hopleaf. Everything was delicious. Great beer selection and nice atmosphere. My only complaint would be that if you want to sit on the bar side, there are no servers to help you. You have to order yourself from the bartender. Seems kind of silly to me. Loved the mussels.

It's a good thing I don't live within walking distance of Hopleaf, because if I did, I'm not sure I'd spend time at any other bars/restaurants. I've been to Hopleaf with both small and big groups, and depending on your timing/luck snagging a table, it's fun for either.  The CB&J sandwich is to die for, duck Ruben is amazing, and their fries are some of the best I've ever had (I am a sucker for the aioli sauce they come with). Food is a taaad on the pricey side, but it's definitely quality. It can get a little loud, so maybe not the best location if you're looking for intimate conversation, but there are also multiple rooms and a patio, so you might be able to find a quiet corner.  Certainly can't forget about the extensive beer menu that is constantly changing... (I've literally had the waitress come to our table and switch out the beer list because they had just updated it). Waiters/bartenders are super helpful in pointing out their favorites, and prices are reasonable so you can try a few!

Crazy selection of draft and bottled beers. As a vegetarian, I was a bit nervous having skimmed the menu of options but more were on the menu in person than online. The Mac and cheese is on par with Kuma's Corner!
Ok I'm a big fan of Hopleaf there selection of beer is vast. It's a cool layout two floors cool decor, and I've had there food  & its great. Another check it out place

Decision tree for deciding if you want to go to Hopleaf: Do you like old-school bars? If yes, go to Hopleaf. If no, do you like food, particularly mussels or frites or anything brasserie-like? If yes, go to Hopleaf. If no, do you like beer? If yes, go to Hopleaf. If no, still go to Hopleaf.
Overrated. Have been there a few times and I while I know they are trying to be creative with their food - it doesn't always deliver. Love the kegged win though. Overall Meh.

I celebrated my 30th birthday with my family and friends on a trolley this past weekend. After having called Hopleaf to ask if we could come by there bar for a beer and confirming that they would have room for us on a Saturday afternoon, we stopped in.  This was our very first stop. Keep in mind that I'm the youngest of the group, so we are all grown adults and we were all very sober. Upon arriving to Hopleaf, without so much as a hello, someone who seemed like a manager and the man working at the front door immediately said to me "we do not take bar crawls". I said "I confirmed that we could come by. We're not on a bar crawl. We just wanted to have a beer and hang out at your bar". He interrupted me and asked who I had talk to. At which point I said "if you do not want our business, I do not want to give it to you". Our trolley driver was very put off by this and went into talk to the men. He felt it necessary to tell them that we were a good group of people, and that we were not drunk. After which they said that we could come in, but at that point I refused to spend a dollar in there bar.  We would have brought them hundreds of dollars of business. Clearly they were too interested in being snobs and extremely rude to get that business. I have never experienced such awful customer service (and I have worked in the industry).  I don't think I will ever return to Hopleaf because of how poorly I was treated. That goes for me and the 20 people I was with.

Love Hopleaf. This might've been the first bar I ever really went to in the Chicagoland area when I was just a young lass.  The beer menu is extensive. Though it does get busy on some days, the space has multiple rooms and you are sure to find somewhere to sit. I also feel like each room and the upstairs area all have a slightly different feel. There's also a patio.  Keep in mind that the upstairs beer menu is slightly different than downstairs (less expansive, but still expansive none the less). This is a good spot to explore exotic beers you've never tried before or may be intrigued by. You can get a 24+ oz speciality bottle and share as well (if you and your comrades can agree on something that is). Food is very good as well but I would advise keeping it minimal. Have gone overboard before and ordered way too much for two people because I was curious. Portion sizes are on the larger size and we ended up with plates of fried food and it was absurd. I like the mussels and the way they are served!

Hopleaf had been on my list based on recommendations from friends for a long time and on my way back from a car inspection in Skokie I got the idea to come here.  I arrived on a weekday right when they opened and it never got too busy although eventually a nice-sized lunch crowd showed up.  Sitting at the bar, I found the service to be friendly, knowledgable, prompt, and professional.  I ended up ordering their famous mussels and two beers and was very pleased with these choices.  I'm sure that at night or on weekends it's a lot busier, but they also have a huge space so I'd be willing to check it out again at night.  Overall, solid place for mussels and beer in Andersonville
Hopleaf is a great place, but if you are hungry don't buy the walleye. Extremely small portion  FYI
A barely 5-star but deserving with how the staff has gone above and beyond on occasion to make things right. The mussels are great; extensive, well thought out procurement of beers; very good venue.

Honest review: theres alot of beer, the food is really good. Its a really big place with an outdoor patio which equals lots of seats. The service is alright theyll clean plates but dont give recommendations or describe menu items they prefer to gossip instead so train them better must orders: charcuterie/ brisket sandwhich/wings/ cb and j/ duck Rueben/ goat cheesecake  Chicken wings 13$ amazin these were so flavorful u could taste all the spices they put on it i liked the addition of cilantro for freshness and the lemon for acidity just combine the two and make a salad instead. My only complaint is plz make them crunchy they were soggy best wings at dos urban cantina these were still amaizin though  Duck rueben 15$ amaizin one of the best dandwhiches i ever had. The bread was supper buttery and toasted the duck was supper tender and flavorful. The sauerkraut was really acidic to cut through the richness. My only complaints is to put more condiments inside dont be cheap after a couple of bites filling is gone  Pomme frites: ask for extra aioli youll thank me. The fries are so crispy without being creasy their not over salted or under salted. Only complaint is to use a unique seasoning or some truffle oil to give it pop. The aioli is so rich and decadent i have no complaints these fries would be my last meal you guys should add some cheese to it too! Cbj  (picture like a cheese plate in a sandwhich) the bread was supper buttery but not toasted as good as the rueben.  The inside is a combination of sweetness from the figs  richness from the ricilite n cashew butter adds savoryness and the mac n cheese adds that funky cheese plate flavor. Only complaint plz dont skimp put more of the ingredients in the sandwhich Beet cake $8 good not great tasted like a carrot cake. Cake was a lil dry. I was expecting more complexity but it was very one dimensional jus sweet and acidity and some wow factor to this still a good fish but u guys can do better  Goatcheese cake $8 best cheese cake ever. The cheese cake was supper smooth like a mouse had the perfect balance of acidity and sweetness. The bottom was supper crunchy and salty so it added texuture the salt cut through the sweetness the blueberry sauce was amaizin adding acidity and sweetness. I loved the basil flavor adding freshness just making it to an icecream instead

So this place is still fun. The beer is generally good.  The staff are great, too.  It always seems kind of bustling, even like during a snowstorm or torrential downpour and the crowd seems strangely academic. We were trying to keep it simple so we ordered the food, too. Entrees are crazy expensive, so you know, we stuck to the sandwiches. I ordered the catfish sandwich and it was served on a pretzel roll, which totally didn't work.  The side salad was great though. The onion rings were dizzyingly good. Ok is that a word? Dizzyingly? Well it is now. So , yep, it's fun and in a great area.
Great rotating draft selection with knowledgeable staff. Food is always consistent. Must have the sausage plate or mussels w/ frites.

I'm not into beer, but a friend invited me to a fundraiser and I was already in the area so I stopped by. The server asked me what I wanted and there were so many options that I was slightly intimidated. I explained my non-beer situation and he made a couple of suggestions. After more hemming and hawing on my part, he basically said get the blossom blend cider. So I did. It was really good! Clean, light, and refreshing. I'd have to try more things before this becomes a 5 star review but I'm definitely a fan so far.

Hey Hopleaf. Party of 9. We arrived at 11:55pm. Asked the manager if we can order food and stay for drinks. We got seated down. Place wasn't that busy. Was told that we have 5 minutes to order food. It was fine with our group, we were coming from the show and were hungry. Got to the bar at exactly 12:00am, was told that the kitchen was closed. Why seating us down with the promise of food (big party of 9!) in the first place. Our intentions were crystal clear to the manager. Food first, then drinks. Just tell us, I am sorry there is no time. If you tell us 5 min, and we get to the bar to order in 5 min at exactly 12:00am. Bartender quote talk to the manager, not my problem. I've been to hopeleaf at least 10 times. Love your food and beer,  decided to go to YOU, of all the other choices around, then THIS. The worst services I've got EVER. BTW, our group left $1300 tab in a place just down the street. Just want you to know that you lost a huge fan.

Came here loved it the bartender is great and always back before your drink is even gone would recommend to anyone That's looking for a nice relaxing place to have some drinks I will definitely be coming back for more
Great atmosphere and cozy atmosphere the bucket of muscles for is wonderful and corn beef brisket is to die for a very nice experience very resonible prices
Lovely drink selection. Some of the food we ordered was A+, and some of it was more like a B-. I'd definitely be back, but not after trying out some similar places first.
Fairly busy most of the time and can be hard to get a table. Food and beers on tap selection if good.

This gastropub was a welcome addition to Andersonville years ago when it only had one store-front.  Now that it has expanded into the space(s) next door, it has only gotten better.  What's not to like about a neighborhood bar (with an expansive selection of beer, wine & cocktails)  that serves top notch food?   Their moules frites, are some of the best.  I've had them prepared with white wine,  or with ale, Belgian style.  The fries are cut in house, and are usually crispy on the outside and served with garlic aioli.  (Truth be told, I love Hopleaf, but sometimes the fries can be soggy...beware...and don't hesitate to send 'em back for some fresh ones).   This visit, I tried the Duck Leg Confit.  The duck was extremely flavorful, redolent of fresh herbs and spices. It sat  on a sweet potato "waffle" of sorts.   Crispy on the outside, perfectly melt-in-your-mouth tender inside.  The duck leg/thigh combo and a duck sausage were accompanied by Brussels sprouts, and a root veg puree and a maple flavored sauce.  You couldn't have done better at a Paris bistro.   Service is always courteous, without being overbearing.  Its a perfect place to sit at the bar and grab a bite, or have a dinner at one of the tables (inside (or outside in the summer) . Hopleaf is a place you will return to time and time again.

We stopped for a bite before a concert on a weeknight & were seated right away.  The atmosphere was nice, the fireplace was going and we were REALLY interested in some drinks and a little food.  For a bar, the food was pretty good. We had the mussels in white wine, the duck ruben & the sausage plate. Absolutely no complaints about the food or service, but I feel it was a bit pricey for the amount of food that was given.. I was teetering on 5 stars here but I'm going with 4 for the price factor only.
I love this place !!!!!  Great watering hole in the Andersonville neighborhood.

Yum!  Note: this is a order-at-the-bar type deal, so the sooner you get your order in, the sooner it will be brought out to you.  I opted for the onion rings which were thinly sliced and then deep fried. Great choice.  They have a large selection of Belgian beers!

Cheap draft beer and wine Great staff and good location If in Andersonville I would come here over every where else!  Did I mention they have chicken liver mousse and pâté?  Will return next time i am up here!

Hopleaf is one of those bars that make me optimistic about the future of the country. Good beer, knowledgeable bartenders. Options for people on draft,bottles. Never eaten here. It's a comfortable place to have a beer or two.

Hopleaf is a very popular beer bar and restaurant... and for good reason! I went to Hopleaf for the first time a few weeks ago. They have a pretty large space, but it's segmented in smaller rooms, creating a more intimate feel in each area. We had a beer upstairs while waiting for a table. There are limited beers on draft upstairs, but plenty of bottles to choose from. There are so many options, you won't have any problems finding a beer you like!   The food was amazing! We had the mussels for two with white wine and fish broth. It very nice and mild, not too fishy. I loved the frites and the accompanying aoli was yummy! My date and I also shared the herbed polenta cake, which was smaller in size, but very savory and flavorful. I loved the mushroom ragout and all the ingredients were very well balanced. We weren't starving and wanted a small and light meal. What we had was absolutely perfect. I definitely want to come back and try the rest of the menu!
What is there to say that hasn't already been said. Great beer list, great menu: enjoyed the charcuterie board, and great staff. Especially Megan! Oh and the bathroom stall art is really quite good.

Overall, I REALLY love this place....knocked a star off, because of inconsistency in food and service.  PROS: Mussels and fries are consistently great; it's without a doubt my favorite dish at the restaurant. Fries are really good...crispy, and a good-sized portion. Beer selection is always extensive, and it's decent service at the bar.I really like the feel of the place, too. It can get very lively and very crowded when it's in full-swing, but it has a really nice intimate pub feel when you sit up front. It's also a huge place, so when they have the whole place open, it's good for busy nights. CONS: Table service has never been spectacular...it's really slow to get drinks, and hit-or-miss in terms of friendly wait staff.While I enjoy ease and speed of service at the bar, the bar tenders can be a bit aloof, and they're either really helpful, or don't care when it comes to recommendations. Anything i've had on their menu outside the mussels hasn't been consistent. I've had the duck ruben a couple times; it's either been good, or completely forgettable. They don't have a ton of vegetarian or vegan options for anyone with dietary restrictions.  If you go for just drinks, it's a great spot for a terrific variety of beer. Dinner can yield some inconsistent service and food.

It's taken me six long years to write this review. Six years of multiple visits to Hopleaf, six years of some of the most delicious mussels in the city, six years of incredible beers from an intensely worldly beer list, and six years of continuously salivating over the Duck Reuben. I've dined in the intimate bar, the main dining room, the relaxing patio, and the new addition with the same quality experience each time. I generally find myself gravitating towards the Kwak to even out the night and always make sure to get plenty of fries with aioli (like a ridiculously stupid amount of fries.) Hopleaf is awesome and continues to be awesome. When I'm in Andersonville, I think about it fondly and try to at least swing by for a quick beer to pay my respects to all the memories it has given me for the past six years.

Gastropub with a boundless drink selection, and a great food selection as well. The grass fed brisket sandwich was delicious, but had a prominent mustard flavor (clearly fresh ground though). The drink menu is helpfully broken down into styles, and should you be curious, the wait staff is knowledgeable and able to give small samples. Everything is high quality and you will not be disappointed with your experience.

I thought the onion ring appetizer was amazing. The garlic aioli with the fries was also really good. The sandwiches were just meh, mostly because the bread was a bit ho hum. Tried the ham, duck, and brisket sandwiches. One person tried the mussels and thought they were good, so that aligned with other reviewers. I will say the beer choices were good.

For me, this place was aces. The broccoli salad alone, I'd go back for. I wasn't a huge fan of the roasted veggies but they were delivered as promised. Their beer selection is extensive and the options for 750ml bottles is great. I hear the mussels is where it's at...I'll go back here for sure.

Why check i.d. on a little old 60-something lady at 1:45 on a Saturday afternoon?  There were a few people sprinkled around, mostly empty, and I easily found my party.  We sat at a booth where the sign said "no table service" so we went to the bar for drinks.  No staff.  Then a guy came to the bar, poured a drink, and left.  He didn't acknowledge our presence. After 4 or 5 minutes, someone took our drink orders.   We ordered food, which was edible but ordinary.  The only vegetarian items were a couple of salads and side dishes. I wanted a hot meal. So I had greasy onion rings and a overpriced little bowl of mac and cheese.  I wandered around the room looking for some napkins to soak some of the grease off the onion rings and finally found some.  They weren't kidding about "no table service" eIt was very cold in the room.  My son had a couple of bad mussels, so he stopped eating. They have an interesting selection of beer, but so do lots a places.  Except for the bad mussels, the food was ordinary. Nothing really terrible happened while we were there, but it was clear that nobody cared, either.  No service, no interest, no smiles or friendliness except from the guy who cleared our table.  No reason to go back...for the same amount of money, we can have an interesting beer selection, at least one hot vegetarian meal option, wait staff, and a welcoming atmosphere.

We just got kicked out of this place because of our baby!!!!!  We had food ordered, wine in glass and beer poured.  We have never been in an establishment that would actively seek out a quiet sleeping child as a threat.  Not going back.

Overall, it's not too bad. Finally tried their Duck Ruben sandwich. Kinda small for what they charge for, but overall, not too bad. I don't know if we'll return since we're not much of beer drinkers ourselves, but it might be a fun place to have a get together.
Exceptional Nusky Ham and fries. Just had a guys night out event there on Friday and 8 of my friends tried 30 plus beers!

Anytime I've ever come here is normally bringing friends in while they were in town. The last time I came here I had one of my friends go to the bar and be told that "we don't serve Mexican piss water here" when he tried to order a corona. I'm glad my friend to it as joke and just let it go because that's pretty messed up.

Honestly was very disappointed. Had heard so many good things and I really don't know what the hype is about. Our waitress Andria was so rude and gave us horrible service. Not sure what crawled up her ass and died. Will never be back. Ever.

Unacceptable DISCRIMINATION! I just entered this bar for dining (straight from work, in casual dress) and the gentleman at the door checking IDs (a bald man at his 40s) was very rude to me and said that I was drunk already, because of my speech - very rude sir!  He can't distinguish an accent (I barely have one) from a drunk person!! I felt disrespected and DISCRIMINATED. I contacted the manager and she was rude and indifferent to what had happened.    I turned around and left without an apology from anyone! Not a good place for non-American natives it seems like. Very sad! VERY SAD!! Not going back there ever again...
The CB&J is an absolute must try! The enormous beer list will also keep me coming back over and over. This is a great spot to come with a couple friends, or for a date.
Very cool place, lots of great beers and awesome glassware just super crowded and hard to grab a seat

Pretty good food and beer, but kind of greasy. I had the CB&J with Mac and cheese as well as the brisket sandwich. The CB&J is almost like a greasy dessert and the brisket needed a bit of support and sauce (toast the bread/stronger bread because it fell apart). But overall both pretty good albeit pricy. I also tried a good number of their beers but our server didn't have good recommendations. My biggest qualm with this place was the service and the bad atmosphere. I went with friends and we were ordering food and drinks the whole night but our waitress kept on putting the check down every so often as if she wanted us to go home? They were hovering over us at some point. Okay place for a QUICK bite to eat with a good beer but there was a serious eat and get out vibe. This is a nice place but it's not THAT upscale, really now.

The place was packed on a weeknight!! It's your average neighborhood bar with a wide collection of beer, which I did not get to try any that night unfortunately.  They have some unique dishes on the menu. The service is fast, staff very helpful and the food is absolutely finger licking good! Come here if you want absolutely delicious though a little greasy, filling, hearty food.  It's very close to home so we will be going there again to try their beer and the food!

The food was absolutely terrible. Not only did it take an absurd amount of time to have our order taken, but once our food arrived, the two main dishes were wrong. The food itself was cold, flavorless, and rubbery. To top everything off, the food is extremely over priced. We will not be coming back.

This is my first review and I downloaded yelp specifically for this review. Service was extremely poor. Sarah paid very little attention to us and we waited 20 minutes before we got drinks. She brought us both the wrong entrees. And when she brought the right ones the food was subpar. Chicken wings were rubbery and cold, mac and cheese was average, but the bottom tasted like the metal skillet it was in. All food was bland with no seasoning. Only good part was the beer. WOULD NOT GO AGAIN. Waste of time and money.

Hopleaf has been on my list for a while, so I was excited to check it out last weekend. We came in around 6 on Saturday. Luckily there were a good amount of seats available, and we grabbed a table at the bar in the back. I liked the ambiance of the second/back room. It's cozy and welcoming. My husband really enjoyed the huge selection of beer. I was going to have a beer too, but saw they had Cab Franc on tap and couldn't resist. I love Cab Franc and this was a good one. It's slightly lighter bodied but has a great complex flavor. I also liked that the wine comes in quarter liters. I may have had 3 of them.  We started with the sausage plate, which was a decent portion and had an interesting selection. Because we're on a serious diet, my husband opted for the mussel frites and I went with the bavette steak frites. The mussels were delicious and came with a heaping portion of fries. The steak was so. damn. good. I said I was going to eat half and take the rest home but we all know that didn't happen. The outside was perfectly charred with a nice crisp and the inside was cooked a perfect medium like I ordered. It was also seasoned well, just salty enough. It was definitely one of the more flavorful steaks I've had. Shout out to the garlic aioli that came with the fries, it was the perfect accompaniment.  We ended up relaxing at the bar for a few hours and enjoying our drinks. The staff was friendly and helpful. I should also say I really liked the fellow patrons. No douchey/annoying people here. Everyone was nice and the table behind us even asked us if we wanted their fries because they hardly touched them (I love you). We live downtown but I hope to make it a regular thing to come back to Hopleaf.
Nice atmosphere, good beer selection, and a creative menu. Vegetable gratin was very tasty. Couldn't really taste the meat in the Duck Reuben, mostly sauerkraut and aoili. But still tasty I guess.

If I reviewed this place 5 years ago: 5 stars Food taste itself: 5/5 Famous for: mussels Last experience not so great Been here multiple times over the years.  No reservations so come here decently early if you're coming on a weekend for dinner. Hopleaf is basically a bar in front and the dining in the back.  Large selection of Belgian beers in the bar up front. Smart move on their part because there's usually a wait for dinner.   Last time I went here, my friend and I got the mussels, salmon and a steak. The mussels are what I come here for.  Always great and even better the next day as leftovers.   Steak was alright.  Salmon dish tasted great but it was undercooked/raw.  I don't mind my fish slightly undercooked as I absolutely hate overcooked seafood, but this was not cooked through to a good temp and was a deep red color like raw tuna. When I brought this up to my server,  she said that the fish is supposed to be like that... Okay...fine, I'll eat it and risk salmonella.  Later on, I found a few fish bones.  At that point, they apologized and gave me a salmon replacement. By the time I got a new salmon, however, I was pretty much full. Disappointed.  Hope they are better next time. Bottom line: will be back,  but cross my fingers for next  time

Save yourself the time and money. This place is overrated. We tried it after a friend recommended it and the wait was extremely long. The staff was rude and inattentive and the food was just bland. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Was my first stop when I got to Chicago. Love the wings and the french fries the dipping sauces were amazing. Zombie dust beer got to get it, have two or three not hard to do cause it's so good! Next time I'm in town again will be my first stop need to try that duck Ruben heard so much about it.

Great food and service! This is my second time coming to Hopleaf and it seems like this place is always crowded which is a good sign!  The place it's a huge and with a good ambiance. The wait for a table could be a little long but it's definitely worth it.  I tried the toasted nueske ham sandwich with fries and it was delicious! The melted cheese complimented the ham and bread perfectly it was very crunchy and warm! We also tried the macaroni and it was also pretty good.  Beer wise I tried an apple cider I know it is not the best thing to try at a beer bar, but I don't like beer. So my review is just for the food and service. Definitely going back.

Try the CB&J - cashew butter, figs, cheese on sourdough, pan-fried..Banging.. Comes with sides of Mac & cheese and house chips. Great beer selection at this place too. Tons of mid-west beers and Belgium beers. The Duck Ruben is another great plate. This place has original amazing tasting food. Will be back.

Went on a Saturday around 2-3, great service, food and beer selection. I had the mussels, which were great. Onion rings are like straws, very addicting. Obviously great beer selection. Did not enjoy the mac--a very strong cheese but that is obviously a personal preference.

Had the CB&J which is cashew butter, figs, cheese on sourdough, pan-fried!!!!! Delicious. Served with some Mac & cheese and house made crispy chips. Have a crazy extensive beer list that is rotating.  I've only been here twice, and had the same thing both times, but the menu seems rather short???  That's my only issue...but I'm content to stick with this amazing sandwich every time I come.

Amazing selection of craft brews but service and food is slightly off. The duck Ruben was disgusting. The bread was drenched in grease. I was holding the sandwich and the sandwich was oozing oil. It was disgusting. The meat was good! My server, Matt, was so rude. He made snide comments to me. No thank you.

My girlfriend likes this place, I'm not a fan. This may be due to the available beers and also the food. Don't get me wrong, the place has a big beer selection, it is just not something I enjoy drinking. This is strange, since I like Belgians beer a lot. Pretty much stuck drinking Temperance all night. Regarding food, I had headcheese the first time around (small and basically the taste of soy sauce was overwhelming) and the pork-chop. I like head cheese, not a fan of eating soy sauce thought. Second time around I went for a sandwich (see picture). I'm pretty sure the sandwich was a mix-up order or one meat sold as something else. It was edible for what it was and I ate it because I was hungry. Service: The service is really good and friendly. It also hopes that they are open late night. I just wish the food/beer was more agreeable to my pallet. I'll be back, but only if the GF requests it.

NO KIDS ALLOWED!!! It's their actual policy!! A craft beer bar after my own heart, finally a place for us to spend our money & enjoy adult company without fussy screaming kids being foisted on us in a place they shouldn't even be allowed. Hop Leaf gets it. We need more pubs like it. Much love to them. (And this place was absolutely PACKED on a Thursday night at a very late hour so clearly those of us who wish to be free of the company of other people's unruly kids, we are legion.) We worshiped at the shrine of amazing beer & enjoyed excellent food in a cozy European cafe atmosphere. 4 stars instead of 5 for two misses-- the guy at the door checking IDs on 12/1 was a total dick & the single cheese on the pricey cheese plate was rubbery & the wrong temperature (very cold), rendering it utterly tasteless.

went here for the first time on the Fourth of July this past summer and was so pleasantly surprised at how much fun we had. the food and drink menu is endless and the CB&J is one of the top 10 sandwiches I've ever had. hopleaf, I will miss you!

Finally stopped in last weekend for lunch with a few friends. The decor is reminiscent of a Belgian/European bistro, and I loved that there was a log burning in the fireplace. I ordered the mussels Belgian style. I was given a large pot of mussels and a huge portion of fries--the mussels were buttery and delicious, and the fries were perfectly crispy. My friends got the duck reuben and really enjoyed it as well. Service was quick and friendly--I'll be back soon!
Super delish. The fries are skinny and taste amazing. I got the ham sandwich and the brisket sandwich. Both amazing choices. My fave was the ham.

Swung in on Friday afternoon for lunch, as soon as you walk in bar its underwhelming but in the back seating by the fireplace is so cozy and the space is loaded character! Super solid beer list zombie dust on tap, how can you go wrong? Great rustic sandwiches.
If you are in Chicago & you don't come Here, you're a doofus . Excellent food, beer, atmosphere &service

One of my favorite bars in this city! I've been going here for at least 15 years, since I've moved to the north side. This bar has expanded my palate and knowledge for beers.  I've always loved the atmosphere whether crowded or not. I love that there is rarely music or if there is it's low so you have the ability to have better conversations. The mussels are a must have. So is the cashew butter sandwich with jam. I've never had anything that's blown my mind but everything I have had has been satiating.  The service has more often than not been extremely friendly. When they are very busy don't expect to take up too much of the bartenders time-because they are busy.

For a beer this place is great. I have found the food to be a little on the greasy side. I know its pub food- but I do expect the food to be a little less greasy to match their amazing beer menu. The beer menu and the selection are amazing! This is a great place to meet with friends and the environment is always great for a work outing.

Another amazing gastropub located in Andersonville that has also been featured on travel shows and food blogs. There's certainly a great ambience once you walk inside and experience either the bar or dining area. Plenty of small tables and open seating if you're simply grabbing a drink, and a larger seating area in the back with high ceilings and wall art. Hopleaf certainly demands that you consume some drafts while inside, but that's not the only thing they're good at. Let's talk about some of that food too! We ordered the House-made Sausage Plate, Mussels and Frites for one, and a Trio platter of their Country Pate, Chicken Liver Mousse, and Spicy Smoked Duck Breast. The sausages were amazing and the variety of spices was on point. Even though we only ordered the mussels "for one," it was enough to feed an entire party of three. As for the trio platter, the duck and chicken liver were both on point. My mouth is salivating just writing about it. The pate was also good, but definitely a lot considering the small amount of pita chips we had that accompanied the spread. I'd pass on this next time. Grab another extra round of beers and really enjoy the variety and tastiness of all the different flavors each plate has to offer at Hopleaf.

Last night I grabbed a seat facing the kitchen, I miss working in the restaurant business. I ordered the kale salad and seared scallops. The kale salad had the perfect balance of fat and acid. The beets, apples, and pumpkin seeds were perfect! I watched the chef make the scallops. His attention to detail was flawless, like an artist with a brush! When this came, I dissected every flavor and nuance. Great food and service. I miss this place!

Literally the most delicious meal I've had in my life. Unexpected yet the flavors and textures are so out-of-this-world. For the first time I am speechless. Get the catfish sandwich!!    Thank you guys for everything!!!
It's like the ultimate beer museum! And in fact the food here is great too.

This is my go-to place for a date, a place to hang with friends, or even just a good meal.  The fries are perfection and the mussels are awesome (take this from someone who lived in Belgium for many, many years).  They have the standard Belgian-style mussels year-round, and then one other kind that changes periodically - just stay away from the wine and fish broth, I tried that recently and it was TERRIBLE.  Service is usually excellent (although the waitress when I got the fish broth mussels was rather rude).  I love, love their beer list and selection of ciders, meads, etc.  I come here pretty often and have several friends who are now big fans since I introduced them to this place.  If you haven't tried it, make the trip (and if you do, be sure to check out Too Much Light Makes the Baby go Blind around the corner - awesome show).  They often have a wait, if you come during peak dining hours, but in that case, you have several options: Wait it out, grab something to snack on at the Middle Eastern Grocery store around the corner on Foster, or try to get a table on the ledge by the kitchen.  It's a hot seat, but if you're starving, it's a way to get in faster.

Went back after years and had a very positive experience. Charcuterie was fresh, creative and delicious. Duck Reuben sandwich was tasty and perfectly executed, as were fries.  All staff was helpful and friendly.  Beers, of course, are varied, well-chosen, and fairly priced.  Sat in outside area, which is fun (although patio heaters would extend the seasons). Definitely coming back.
One of my favorite places to get a beer in the city. So many good things on tap, one place I know I can get zombie dust whenever I want. Food is terrific, wish the would bring back the corn!

Ever go to restaurants where everything is good but you can't bring yourself to stray from getting the same thing every time? That's here, with the mussels, for me. The broth the mussels come in is an Umami bomb. I want to bath in it. I always order more bread to sop up all the deliciousness. On my recent visit, I asked to take the remaining broth home and it starred in one hell of a shrimp linguine dish I made the next day. I can't forget to mention the frites and aioli though. The aioli is garlicky goodness and the frites are plentiful. The quantity of frites is larger than a $6 side that I've received at other restaurants.  Prices are reasonable too. The mussels and frites for one run $13. They never charge more when I request additional bread. They're currently renovating their main room and was told the space will have more of an open feel and will help with crowding.
Love love love it here!  My Babette steak was awesome!  We wish they served a speciality burger.  Nice People, great staff!  Friendly
This is one of my favorites places in Chicago. I've been there several times, and the large selection of draft beers always make me want to come back and try a new one

I came here yesterday for lunch and had the Duck Reuben and it was delicious!  The fries were great and the ambiance was nice.  I'm excited to come back at night when they allow people sit on the interior upstairs patio area, for some reason during the day you can't sit up there so we'll have to come back!

I love the hopleaf food menu. Moulle-frites are perfect & many other good locally made dishes. The beer selection is stellar. Hundreds. About 50 have their own glasses. I am a longtime and admittedly miss sun cheese nite with 12 people--but the improvements are worth it. Great outside if you can get a seat.

One of our son's favorite spots, so we had to like it. Huge beer list, made better by his help in picking the best ones. Loved the chicken wings and house made potato chips, liked the charcuterie, fries, and the mussels. Rocking noisy atmosphere on a Friday night, no reservations taken. Very popular--it must be good, right?

Ambience is great and very typical urban pub. However I was a bit disappointed in the food. Came here in early evening on a a Wednesday; had no trouble getting in. Wanted to try the duck Reuben. The pumpernickel was toasted too much; very dry. The duck meat was fatty and not very much. The whole sandwich was thinner and less flavorful than what I was hoping for. Saw this place on TV and thought it would better than it was....

You'd never know this was such a great beer bar walking by it but they've got a great selection of belgian and other midwestern beers. It's also quite large on the inside so you could probably bring a pretty large group in here. We were here late night so I didn't get to try any of the food but if I return (and I hope I do) i'll eat something and update this.

An unassuming bar from the outside, but it hides a lovely dining area in the back and even lovelier patio in the backyard. The wait staff is friendly and know the menu so well that they can make great recommendations.  I had the Mussels in the Sweet Corn & Tarragon Broth by my their recommendaton and it was perfect. The slivers of sautéed fennel, sweet pops of corn and steamed mussels in a tarragon miso broth. It comes with two little loafs of crusty bread to soak up all the flavor, but the broth was so delicious that I just drained the whole pot after I ran out of bread. There is also a large funnel of fries that I was barely able to make a dent in. The mussels goes perfectly with a cold glass of their Hopleaf Patio Tree Cider, made from their own apple trees!!  A definite recommendation if you are in the area.

Love the beer and food selection! Go-to beer: delirium Runner up: anything else Belgian, which they have plenty.  Food is really good. Vibe is energetically fun. I've visited about a dozen times, and have always had a blast here, with exceptional service.  Highly recommend for great beers, good food, fast service, and it's young spirit vibe.

Went here while on a short trip to Chicago. The beer selection is amazing and my brisket sandwich was great. But what I will remember from this meal for a very long time is their French fries. Best fries I have ever eaten. Ever.

The low down on Hopleaf for me: Great beer selection, but not feeling the vibe here. Maybe had to do with the fact we visited on a really quiet Sunday afternoon and opted to just sit in the front self serve bar area. Buuuut, if you like craft beer, their selection is top notch. They had Stone's Mocha IPA which I'd only heard thru word of mouth from my friends back home, and somehow they had it on draft out here in Chicago. The coffee flavors mixed with the hops is trippy. I expected more of an IPA style beer with bitterness and all just due to the color of the beer, but when you drink it almost tastes like you drinking a stout. Really weird but cool at the same time. Anyways, only did one round here before heading back on the road on our Sunday funday bar crawl. I'd have to give this one another visit and hit the sit down area in the back and probably order food to get a real feel for this place. 'Til next time, cheers!

Had lunch the other day at Hopleaf, and really enjoyed our meal. We both ordered the brisket sandwich, which is basically a corned beef sandwich, served with a ton of fries. The fires are great and served with a garlic aoil. (Which was awesome) The brisket is really good, but a little on the fatty side. One of the best features of this establishment is that they have a strict 21 and over policy. (No one under 21 is allowed, regardless if they have an adult with them or not) The combo of a great meal teamed with no screaming children makes this place a winner with me!

We had such a nice dinner at Hopleaf.  Our waitress was great and she explained the menu since we hadn't been there before.  We had the duck Reuben, Fried Catfish sandwich and CP&J sandwich.  All fabulous.  We didn't have their famous mussels but most people around us seemed to be enjoying them.  The beer selection was extensive. Check it out next time your are in the Andersonville neighborhood of Chicago.

Went here once on a date. Very romantic atmosphere. They have a huge selection of beers. I really wanted to try their chicken but I guess it's very popular cause they were out when I was there around 10-11pm. So I order the mussels. It was sooooo good! Love the creamy sauce they used. I still want to try that chicken though!!!
Love this place. Huge beer selection, great environment, and the dishes are well designed and delicious. A great place to get a quick drink, meet a friend, or have a full on dinner date.
Great environment! I love the multiple levels and the obscenely large beer selection!

No TVs here . If you want a traditional pub close to what you might find in Europe with over 60 beers on tap this is the place for you. Friendly staff and the beer will be poured to the rim. I had a problem with the Belgian mussels but it was quickly remove from my bill. I couldn't be happier. If you're looking for a sports bar this is not your place but if you want beers around the world you're home.

Really cool spot. It's a gastropub with 3 levels. Came here for the first time last weekend for a birthday. The drinks are really good and it's very spacious, so you can enjoy drinks with friends without having to fight the crowds. Apparently the food is really good, but I've only had their drinks. I will definitely be back and will try their food next time.

Frites and garlic aioli = yum! They came with the mussels (1# for $13). The mussels were ok, a bit small, but the frites were plentiful and the aioli was so good. I ate way past the point of full because I couldn't stop!  The front booths have ripped seats. Wish we would have walked to other seating areas as others mentioned. Next time!

Hopleaf is one of our favorite gastropubs in Chicago. The extensive beer menu, excellent food, and great service keep us coming back every month. Our typical food order includes the mussels for two, which comes with frites, and occasionally we will split an appetizer, too.

I keep getting the mussels here expecting it to be different, and it's always just okay. That's a shame since I really like mussels. Their beer selection is great, the staff is friendly and very helpful. I've had their wings which are dry rubbed and then fried. They're tasty, a bit heavy on the celery salt. And I think their sauce could use some more butter.  The onion rings are good, though I did find a hair in one once... So, take that for what it's worth.  The aioli served with their fries is super garlicky and delicious.
I really like going to Hopleaf with friends or with my family! I wouldn't say it's good for kids but it is a great place for groups. Their back patio is gorgeous!!

This place has been my favorite for years. I love to go here when I want a really nice meal but I don't want to travel downtown or have reservations somewhere. The menu changes a lot and it's worth it to try things that are in season. But the mussels and steak are always great and always worth it.
They have so many Great Lakes options available for a Chicago bar  and the corn fritters and onion rings were both delicious. Very friendly staff.

Great Belgian beer selection. The Kwak a gotta try Belgian beer. Interesting glass. But I like Chimay Cenq Cents. Had the brisket sandwich. Wife had the duck Ruben. Great service. Fun place. Coming back.
Delicious food, wonderful and friendly staff. Amazing selection of beer and ciders from around the world.

I can't say much more about Hopleaf than anyone else has.  I will note that since they opened up the addition, wait times have taken a nose dive which is very welcomed.  Food is always great and varied (but get the mussels!).  Beers....... so many beers.  Very knowledgeable bartenders and staff.  They do takeout if you can't get a seat or are in a hurry to get home.  FYI, it's 21 and over (checking ID's at the door) - and NO KIDS.  So, leave them at home or with a sitter.

If I ever moved out of Chicago this would be one of the first places I'd go to when I came back to visit. I don't eat shellfish, in fact I'm allergic to most seafood, and I find mussels disgusting but somehow Hopleaf not only makes them well, but they're amazing!  Also a huge fan of the steak frites.  Id be remised to not mention their killer beer menu as well

We were unfortunately underwhelmed by this restaurant after hearing rave reviews from our friends. We ordered the mussels, smoked wings, beef brisket sandwich and all were good but nothing that could top places like Glenn's Diner.

I have been to Hopleaf many times. I am a huge fan of the Duck Reuben sandwich. Hopleaf has an ok wine selection, but the food is always amazing. I enjoy the laid back vibe and the great service. I do not like to be hovered over or ignored. Somehow Hopleaf has mastered their timing of when to check in perfectly. Hopleaf is amazing because your ambiance changes based on where you decide to sit. I opt for the bar or back dining room personally. The menu is simplistic. The lack of "we make everything" is wonderful. Hopleaf focusing on a few dishes that they do very well is the way to go. I have never ordered something that was not fabulous. Hopleaf keeping being wonderful!

I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. I was the first of my party to arrive so I sat at the bar and ordered a beer while I was waiting. When it comes to beer, I pretty much know what I like and don't like so beer lists aren't sooo overwhelming -- which is good, because this place has every beer ever. I went with the St-Feuillien blonde (please don't ask me to pronounce that) and it was really tasty. I had a sip of it before ordering thanks to the bartender. Partly because of the beer and partly because of a huge lunch at Eleven City in Lincoln Park, I wasn't very hungry for dinner. Luckily, Hopleaf has a great selection of appetizers. This definitely made it hard to choose and I was between the quail and the corn fritters. The waiter said the corn fritters were on the heavier side, so I went with the quail.  It was delicious and the perfect amount of food. One of the great things about this place was that everything else on the plate complements the main part of the dish so well. The corn puree went perfectly with the zucchini bread. The red pepper coulis went perfectly with the quail. The whole dish was delicious and I would order it again.
No way! They have gotten to be pompous! A salad of a handful of arugula, six pieces of heirloom tomatoes and some radishes - Should never cost $10. O'Hare is cheaper!

I wanted to give this review one star because they wouldn't let my group of 6 sit outside and the service wasn't that good, but the beer choices and food earned it another two stars. Details below.  1.  It was such a beautiful day today, my group picked Hopleaf so that we could sit in their outdoor section. However, they refused to seat us outside because they were "reserving those tables for guests who want to eat."  Mind you, it was 3pm and they were not busy at all. There may have been two tables occupied outside while we were there. I'm sure they wished church would let out and everyone would flock to Hopleaf, but it didn't happen.  2.  We sat inside and had a few rounds of excellent draft beer. We also decided to eat despite being spurned earlier, and the food was very good too.  Service was not great and we would have preferred to sit outside, but everyone seemed to like the beer and food.
This place is for beer lover not for food lover. The food was salty (they probably did it on purpose to go with their beers). The taste wasn't impressive. They failed on their mussel dish.

Hopleaf has been such a neighborhood spot for years and I have enjoyed it throughout the years.  But I feel like more recently, I haven't been as impressed.  The beer list is good and they've really stretched it past the Belgium beers that they used to mostly have, however I think you can find a really solid and extensive beer list a lot of other places in the city and neighborhood. I find the service to be hit or miss.  But what's been most disappointing is the food.  The menu is not very exciting and the food just doesn't taste very good.  Recently we went with friends and everything felt the food was at best average. I think it's s cool place to grab a beer but I'm just not crazy about the food (other than that French dry dipping sauce!).

Outstanding spot for beer and good food, albeit perhaps a bit noisy.  Very reasonable food costs as the alcohol sales are likely carrying the spot.  The menu is unique, food well prepared, and wait staff courteous and responsive.  Definitely worth the trip.

Usually crowded.  Staff are universally manbunned, not quite hygienic looking hipsters with bad attitudes.  Rude and dismissive and condescending.  The food is good but the amount of BS you have to deal with at this noisy, crowded cramped place makes it totally not worth it.
Celebrated and pretentious ale house (celery and apple slaw with dessert anyone?) that excels at classic food and drink. Minus one star for the stink of arrogance from the host and servers.

Cool bar with a relaxed and unpretentious vibe. No one pretends to be hipstery here, you've got all sorts of folks!  My friend and I split the green curry mussels for 2 for around $24. Deeeelicious! Broth was superb, I could stop drinking it! Fries come with the order and they're bomb. Huge selection of beer, 2 bars, ample seating, communal seating, and patio seating too. Although they do get busy later in the night, it never feels crowded! My one complaint is that it's really dark inside during the day so you're better off trying to snag a seat at the patio, but beware the wait!

Such a cool place. Love the ambience here. Have been here many times for beer (great selection) and also for dinner. I tried the mussels belgian style, which were great. Fries were such a big portion and were delicious. I had the ham and Gruyere sandwich, which was very good. My husband had their famous brisket sandwich but liked mine better!!! The service was pretty good, but they served my beer in the wrong glass (16 oz instead of 22 oz. glass). When I asked the waitress about it, she didn't believe me and made me show her the menu. Then she claimed that they ran out of the proper glassware and that they would bring a half glass for me later (which they did), but if my husband didn't point it out, I think I would have paid for the 22 oz beer and only got the 16 oz pour. Just read the beer menu carefully and make sure you get what you are paying for. Great place regardless with good food (though main entrees are fairly expensive (over $20 for most) so we stuck to the sandwich menu).

If you are a beer lover, this place is for you. There are so many options, it will be hard to choose what to drink. I ordered the Revolution Rosa Hibiscus Ale. It was floral and refreshing. I shared the Fried Catfish Hoagie - cornmeal-dusted, remoulade, lemon-tabasco pickles and frisée served with fries. I thought the hoagie was delicious - perfectly fried, with a spicy kick from the remoulade. The fries were good too, but just a touch salty for my taste. My friends ordered the famous Mussels and Frites and enjoyed their meal as well. I love that Hopleaf has equally good food and drinks. I'll be back!

Returned for another wonderful late lunch. I had the fried catfish sandwich which was absolutely fantastic. It comes with a bucket of crispy fries.  I also had the Kwak beer which was amazing. Sweet Amber colored extremely tasty beer.  I love this place.

I love coming here! Very chill place with a great beer list and good food. I've come here different days of the week and at different times. It's lively enough (even in the middle of the day) but never too crowded (even on Saturday nights). The crowd is always pleasant, no one gets too rowdy, and the noise level is at a level comfortable enough to have a conversation with the people at your table. There is a ton of seating in this place, and I've come here with groups of more than 8 people and we've never had problems finding a place to sit.  P.S. I think several other reviewers have said this, but my favorite thing to get here is the Zombie Killer cider! I'm not much of a cider drinker and I would usually prefer beer, but after trying this cider I've been hooked!

I had a very bizarre situation at Hopleaf.  When I came to the door a pudgy doorman in his late forties asked me for my ID. I'm okay with that, but I'm 52 years old and look well over 30. I didn't have a problem with providing the ID, but I joked about it when I pulled it out. Apparently this guy had it in for me after that. I'm a little bit older than their average customer and feel that I was very treated badly because of my age. For no reason at all this "doorman" and a skinny waiter walked up to me while I sat at the bar with my first beer and asked me to leave. The only contact I had made there was with the doorman and bartender to order my beer. Something's wrong with those people. I left because it was late and I had just missed the friend I was there to meet anyway, & wasn't in the mood to deal with these jerks. My advice is to avoid this place at all costs. There are too many good brew pubs and gastropubs in the area to frequent places that do not treat their patrons well.

Day 305: Hopleaf: Went here for a small going-away shindig. It was my first time there, which was odd, since it has been consistently recommended to me as a quality neighborhood location. And though it was indeed Trendy (which, as I've implied in previous reviews, really means "so loud that you can't hear anyone more than 18 inches away"), it had a good vibe and, with the shudders open, a cool breeze running through. I had the mussels with pomme frites and a nice goblet of Zombie Killer which is apparently the perfect accompaniment. I also munched from a plate of my tablemate's onion straws.  And, well... It was very nice evening. Sometimes that's all you need.

Always busy, always cozy, always great. I LOVE a Belgian beer, so this a go-to for a delicious beer fix (rare in Chicago, if you don't like the standard midwest hoppy junk). They also have a good menu of solid entrees and food. And of course, plenty of bearded hipsters in this Andersonville staple. Love it!

Long time coming but here it is. This place is phenomenal! Epic!  The beer selection is sure to please even the pickiest of beer connoisseur, don't like beer?  Great wine, and cocktails. The ambiance, the people, the food. Best place in Chicago by far.
Good beer. Mediocre food. Bad atmosphere. Also, really time to get over yourselves and let kids in if only during the day. No good reason not to, particularly in this neighborhood.
Amazing beer selection and great food. You can't go wrong with the steak frites or brisket sandwich. Can get a little crowded on the weekends otherwise no complaints!

Never disappoints!!! Great Chicago food/beer landmark!! Food is all great, one all time favorite is the C B & J on sourdough; house-made cashew butter, fig jam & raclette cheese, pan-fried; w/ stilton mac-&-cheese & house-made potato chips ( or frites!) LOVE IT!!!!!
"Great beer list, try the Temperance from Evanston! The bavette steak and frittes was terrific, and onion rings were divine. And Andersonville is a great neighborhood.

Belgium bar in Andersonville with huge list of import beers. Good vibe in the bar. Besides that, not much else that stands out. Food is average bar food, service was weird. After 10pm you have to walk to the bar to order? Why? So bartender can get more tips? Odd, hire a server. Wings - B Brisket sandwich - C Salmon entree - B Service = odd

Only good thing we had were the fries. What we ordered; mussels for one ( Belgium style) fucking flavorless. Same with the Mac n cheese. Looked great, tasted bad. The cheese board was decent. I had the brisket sandwich and my boyfriend had the duck reuben...both not good. Total tab $80, worth it? Not at all. Never coming back, never recommending this place. Service was fine though. Ask for hot sauce, you'll need it for everything to add some sort of flavor!

I found it interesting when my girlfriend had told me that Jon Taffer and his crew had come through and proposed a bar rescue because this place was the definition of unique. Located in downtown Andersonville, Chicago, Hopleaf isn't your conventional bar/restaurant and their menu reflects that. Boasting one of the finest beer menus in the Midwest and a menu with flavors in all directions, you're not just guaranteed to find something you'll like - you'll find something you'll love. Potential complaints would be that there is no television and it is always a 21+ establishment even during the day so grab a sitter, put your phones down and enjoy yourself.

Nothing but good things about this place. They have an extensive menu that covers beer, cyder (and cysers) and some wine. The food isn't too terribly expensive either. I had the brisket sandwich which was really good and my husband ordered the cashew butter and jelly sandwich which he loved. For my drink I ordered the Zombie Killer cherry cyser which was amazing. I would absolutely come back again and try more of their offerings.

WOAH man! From the outside, this place was very unassuming. What we thought was a small, cozy, and hip little bar opened up into a vast, multi-dimensional haven for beer and pub food. There's a ground floor with two areas - each with a separate bar - but also an upstairs section with a balcony eating area as well as an upstairs 'patio' (which is just another room). Being from the west coast, I was surprised at how plentiful Zombie Dust was at various local bars. Hopleaf certainly had plenty of this liquid gold of a pale. And it doesn't stop there. Their bottle list was also exceptional. You'll find bombers of rare and limited releases along with some other goodies. My boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised to see a bottle of Bourbon County Rare just chillin in the [locked] fridge. Too bad we didn't have anyone to share it with because while it's wonderful to discover these rarities at bars, BCBS Rare was $70.  Food wasn't too bad. The mussels for 1 at $13 served as a great appetizer between the two of us. The meat board was different with all the various kinds of meats, but scrumptious. The salmon for $25 though seemed like overkill especially for the portion. Whether you want to sit back and enjoy a brew with friends in a casual and social setting or scope out rare bottles maybe while pairing them with great food offerings, Hopleaf has it all. More than anything, I was surprised at the mere size of the place and all the great beer on tap. That in and of itself is enough to satisfy someone like me!

I expected more from Hopleaf. The location in Andersonville is great, especially for someone who doesn't have the patience to go all the way from Evanston to Lincoln Park or River North for good Chicago dining. The beer list is, predictably, fantastic, with plenty of delicious Belgian Strong Darks/Quads on the menu. The service (if I recall) was fine, and the overall atmosphere is nice. The menu looks great: familiar yet inventive, and pairs well with beer. But the food just didn't deliver. The short ribs were fatty. I know short ribs can get this way, but our serving didn't have enough meat to justify all of the fat. The duck reuben, which sounded great, was not very good. The flavors were jumbled and the bread was too heavily buttered. The whole thing was greasy and did not sit well with me. I woke up very sick to my stomach the next morning, and while I think the culprit was a virus and not food poisoning, the greasiness of the meal the night before did not help.

I was told to come here the next time I was in Chicago and I was not disappointed. Huge beer selection with a lot of beers I don't get at home and the food was even better. I had the brisket sandwich which was incredibly tender and tasty. It was a Montreal style brisket which was different from what I was expecting and was a pleasant surprise. I will be back

This place is glorious. They take a lot of pride in the quality of their beer, and advocate for smaller breweries just getting started in the Chicago area. I've been there for dates, a Marz brewery event, and hanging with friends! Their event space upstairs is great for small gatherings, and the garden out back is wonderful for when you want to feel luxurious.  Being in the midwest I'm still just a little wary of seafood (I know Chicago is a hub, and the seafood is still pretty fresh, but still...), but I gotta say those mussels are pretty freakin' great. Now go!

Go to the Hopleaf Toasted Neuske sandwich video on the travel channel and skip ahead to 4:05. Look at that sandwich. It's not the Neuske, it's the brisket. Looks amazing right? Then why oh why, when I ordered it, DID I NOT GET IT ? Hell, I even double checked with the server, who took one look and said "oh yeah that's the brisket all right". We're talking dry roast beef on rye. It wasn't even good for what it was.  Look at the photo I posted. Tell me I'm crazy. My gf and I were so disappointed, we left our zombie dusts.  I'm not the type to leave one star on a whiny whim, but this time we for real got played. Again, watch the video, then check out the photo. Buyer beware.

Just ok this time for us. We sat at the bar, not very crowded yet just as dinner service was starting. My fiance enjoyed trying a new beer on tap. They had a few ciders, only one that I liked, as long as there is one though. My main complaint for this visit is that we ordered mussels to go with our drinks. 45+ minutes and empty glasses later, we just asked to pay for the drinks and go. Major disappointment.

Wow! What took me so long to get here??? So, I am not a beer drinker but I do enjoy a good cider and Hopleaf does not disappoint. There were about 4 types to try. I sat at the bar where the bartender was super friendly and attentive. He also did not hesitate to make recommendations. I enjoyed both ciders (Cherry something and a hawk something??). Food wise they also did pretty well. I had the catfish hoagie with a side salad. Side note: What ever vinaigrette the salad was tossed in needs to be bottled and sent to my house immediately because I can't stop thinking about it. The hoagie was good and the catfish was seasoned well. So, excited about this place. I'm going to have to make another trek up north for this soon!
The mac n cheese is super good! I got a "brisket" that was actually corned beef (enter vomit emoji here). My stomach actually hurt for two days after eating here. Won't be back unfortunately!
I love this place and do not make it here as much as I wish I did. The duck sandwich is *amazing*  and the beer selection is great.  I will for sure be back.

I hadn't been to Hopleaf in years due to traumatic memories of a 2 plus hour wait. I had heard they expanded a while back and decided to give it another try ( with a plan b of a great Korean place down the street).
